section.p: Your prayers are answered; Akugenda’s vengeful ghost is snuffed out leaving only a wisp of brown smoke and the acrid smell of ozone.
Kiyomori looks at his men, most of whom are crouching back in terror, and then at you, standing boldly with your hand upraised to ward off evil.
‘Come down to my villa,’ he says. ‘We’ll have supper.’
You spend a pleasant evening dining on the veranda, which gives a majestic view out to sea. You have done well for yourself making friends with Kiyomori; he is the most powerful man in the country.
